evaluate¶

Module for course model evaluation @author Siddharth Reddy <sgr45@cornell.edu> 01/09/15

evaluate.cross_validated_auc(model_builders, history, num_folds=10, random_truncations=False)¶

Use k-fold cross-validation evaluate the predictive power of an embedding model on an interaction history

Parameters:
  • function] model_builders (dict[str,) –

    A dictionary that maps the name of a model to a function that builds and trains it:

    (history, filter_history, init_params, init_model) -> CourseModel
  • history (InteractionHistory) – An interaction history
  • num_folds (int) – Number of folds to make training-validation splits on. 1 < num_folds <= num_students_in_history
  • show_plots (bool) – True => show plot of average error vs. prefix length False => don’t show any plots
Return type:

dict[str, (float,float,float,float)]
Returns:

A dictionary mapping model name to a tuple of (training average log-likelihood, training roc auc, validation average log-likelihood, validation roc auc)
